До покупки игры думал, что это примитивные догонялки и прятки.  Игра не вызывала у меня впечатления после просмотра видео геймплеем . Однако я решился таки её взять и посмотреть, что к чему. Поиграв сам я понял, что все устроено несколько хитрее и матч может сложиться совершенно по разному. Если вы считаете так же как считал я, то вы ошибаетесь. Всё намного разнообразнее и интереснее. Здесь можно залипнуть на более чем 300 часов (сам пока только 30 наиграл, но уверен мне она не скоро наскучит). Так что рекомендую!
Cпустя миллион лет пофиксили хотя бы хиты через палетки. Спасибо.

this game is trash

Despite all criticism, Dead by Daylight endures as one of the most popular multiplayer titles on Steam (ranked #20 in November 2019). It has survived where its would-be-successor Deathgarden Bloodharvest has failed, for two simple reasons: Its gameplay and the ongoing investment of the developers in their product.

The gameplay is deceptively simple. You are either one of four survivors who have to escape a sinister arena or you are a killer, hunting said survivors. The initial fascination with DbD stems largely from playing a survivor, sneaking, trying to open the exit gates under a pale moon, then suddenly hearing a heartbeat coming closer, running, running...

But after that initial horror has run off, DbD reveals its second allure: A gameplay that is based on tactical use of time and teamwork. The killer must kill survivors off, but it takes up to three attempts to do so, while the survivors keep working on their escape. Stalling the killer, using your skills, tools and - if nothing else works - health to delay his victory is essential. It is great fun once you have learned the basics (the hard way) and the asymmetrical nature of the core concept works really well.

Add to that the number of killers you can play (the survivors become more or less interchangeable after a certain point of progress), ranging from unknowns like the beartrap-laying  aptly named trapper or a ghostly flying nurse to horror icons such as Michael Myers and Freddy Krueger and you can see the appeal. The developers keep adding killers which can be either bought in (slightly overpriced) DLC or unlocked ingame, as well as a multitude of (definitely overpriced) skins. A recent addition has even brought backstory for killers and survivors alike, unlocked via a set of increasingly difficult challenges. Mastering the killers and collecting said backstories will take a lot of your time, but it is time well-spent.

I do have some criticisms, of course. The game is really hard on beginners, as much of the tactics depend on perks which have to be unlocked in a long, grindy process. It also misleads you at times (never try to free yourself from a hook as a beginner!) and it still suffers from long waiting periods in the lobby. At least they have managed to get the problem of massive lags under control, which haunted DbD for quite some time. Other players can also be really toxic. Try not to throw your keyboard against the wall, after some smarmy survivor has blinded your killer and escaped. Instead try to learn from and emulate his tactics in your next survivor run. It is tempting to only play survivor. But you will understand the killers better if you have spend a while in their shoes.

My final verdict on the current version of DbD (Nov 2019) would be [b]8/10 medkits[/b].

It is a great asymmetrical multiplayer title which can keep you busy for years to come and it still has a lot of potential to be explored (anyone else want to see Chucky or the Leprechaun in there?) Horror fans especially will have a field day with the game.

Just don't buy a skin for 10 Euro. Seriously.

This is a great game in so many ways. Not only does it have the spooky things that keep you in the zone, but it has a daring and strategic survival basis which keeps you and the three other players working for that one common goal of finishing the round successful. Sacrifices are of course necessary sometimes, which can piss some people off who have too much of an ego to risk putting themselves in danger which in turn can anger you as well. Sometimes this leads to players being salty, trolling, or otherwise having a negative playing style. Other people's poor and self-absorbed actions can directly effect your rewards, so I usually play a bunch and take a break for a few weeks to cool down. Nonetheless, the staff team can't do much to prevent these side effects of creating an amazing game; 8/10 would recommend.

Sure, this is a fun game and one of my favorites, and I do recommend playing it to an extent. But whoever the heck is making this game needs to get their act together, its better than it was a year ago, but the amount of bugs, internet issues, and cancerous players make you want to punch a hole through your monitor. Basically, they need to implement more punishments for those who take advantage of problems and loopholes in the game. The creators need to stop creating DLC and fix the game, as this game has incredible potential and is so so so much fun.
